sentences.en: But also because his deviance is psychologically subversive to the others'spontaneous virility.
sentences.cn: 同时也因为他的偏差,对于他人潜意识中的男性气质有著心理学上的破坏性.

sentences.en: But first it needs to regain its virility.
sentences.cn: 但是,首先它必须重振雄风.

sentences.en: Finally add virility with a Cedar note.
sentences.cn: 以富男性气质的雪松为后调.

sentences.en: Hill with thick, calendar vicissitudes virility.
sentences.cn: 山以其厚重, 历沧桑而为之雄浑.

sentences.en: In the Middle Ages, men wore them to symbolise their courage and virility.
sentences.cn: 中世纪, 男人们佩戴钻石,作为勇敢和刚强的象征.

sentences.en: Listen to their voices, high permeability delicacy, sweetest fluidity tenor and bass virility powerful.
sentences.cn: 聆听其声音, 高音通透细腻,中音清脆圆润, 低音雄浑有力.

sentences.en: Maasai men are known to demonstrate their virility by spearing elephants.
sentences.cn: 马赛族人以刺戳大象展现男性气概闻名.

sentences.en: This may hobble the bull in the future. But first it needs to regain its virility.
sentences.cn: 这可能使这头牛将来蹒跚而行, 但目前它首先需要重振雄风.

sentences.en: To deprive of virility or spirit; emasculate.
sentences.cn: 使丧失精力或精神; 使软弱.

words.tran_cn: 男性的；有男子气概的；刚健的
男子气；男子特点；生殖力

trans.tran_en: the typically male quality of being strong, brave, and full of energy – used to show approval
